intro: Xiphion latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features strap-like leaves that are broad and flat, often reaching several inches in length. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Xiphion latifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
